citation.article-title: Salinicoccus sesuvii sp. nov., isolated from the rhizosphere of Sesuvium portulacastrum
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinicoccus sesuvii sp. nov.
Salinicoccus sesuvii [se.su′vi.i. N.L. gen. n. sesuvii of Sesuvium, isolated from Sesuvium portulacastrum L. (sea purslane)].
Gram-staining-positive cocci, about 1.0–1.2 µm in diameter.
Oxidase- and catalase-positive; an oxidative metabolism is shown.
Good growth occurs after 48 h on tryptone soy agar and marine agar 2218 at 28 °C.
No growth occurs on MacConkey agar at 28 °C.
No growth occurs at 2 or 45 °C.
Growth occurs with 1–25 % (w/v) NaCl [optimum 8–10 % (w/v) NaCl].
Colonies on nutrient agar are smooth, pinkish, circular, translucent and shiny with entire edges.
The characteristic diamino acid of the cell wall is lysine.
The quinone system is composed mostly of menaquinone MK-6, with traces of MK-7.
The polar lipid profile contains major amounts of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and an unidentified glycolipid, and minor amounts of two unidentified lipids.
The polyamine pattern contains major amounts of spermidine.
The characteristic fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
Physiological tests (including differentiating characters obtained using identical conditions) are indicated in Table 2.

Acid is weakly produced from d-glucose and maltose, but no acid is produced from sucrose, adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, myo-inositol, lactose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, d-sorbitol or d-xylose.
Urease, indole production and hydrolysis of casein, gelatin, starch, DNA and tyrosine are negative.
Aesculin hydrolysis and arginine dihydrolase are positive, but H2S production and lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and β-galactosidase (ONPG) are negative.
Only a few compounds are utilized, among them N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, d-glucose, maltose, pyruvate and dl-lactate.

As sole sources of carbon, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, d-fructose and trehalose are utilized, but not acetate, propionate, N-acetylgalactosamine, l-arabinose, l-arbutin, cellobiose, d-galactose, gluconate, glycerol, d-mannitol, maltitol, α-melibiose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose, salicin, d-xylose, adonitol, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, putrescine, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, 4-aminobutyrate, adipate, azelate, fumarate, glutarate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, 2-oxoglutarate, suberate, citrate, mesaconate, l-alanine, β-alanine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-serine, l-aspartate, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-proline, l-tryptophan, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate or phenylacetate.

The chromogenic substrate p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucopyranoside is hydrolysed weakly, but p-nitrophenyl-α-d-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-xylopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucuronide, bis-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate, bis-p-nitrophenylphenylphosphonate, bis-p-nitrophenylphosphorylcholine, 2-deoxythymidine-2′-p-nitrophenylphosphate, l-alanine-p-nitroanilide, γ-l-glutamate-p-nitroanilide and l-proline-p-nitroanilide are not hydrolysed.
The type strain is CC-SPL15-2T ( = DSM 23267T = CCM 7756T), isolated from the rhizosphere of Sesuvium portulacastrum.
